newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian economy growing strongly - Howard.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian economy growing strongly - Howard.

text.p: Australian Prime Minister John Howard said on Friday the economy was fundamentally sound and growth was quite strong.
Howard said the economic outlook for 1997 was better than six months ago.
"The economy now is stronger than what it was in many respects a year ago," Howard said during a radio interview with the Australian Broadcasting Corp.
"It is fundamentally sound. It is growing quite strongly, and the omens this year for the economy are a lot better than they were six months ago," he said.
The government has forecast gross domestic product growth of 3.5 percent in the 1996/97 year (July-June), led by a 17 percent rise in business investment.
